\" />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 11 Aug 2020 20:30:00 +0000","feedId":7159,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"92d64e36547482ed94ebef3931c86768","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"lkolowich@hubspot.com (Lindsay Kolowich)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/content-calendar-excel-tabs.jpg?width=1362&name=content-calendar-excel-tabs.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn84@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-22-22-279_f90ca5b0d2e1dd8f.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/social-media-calendar-month-view.png?width=669&height=388&name=social-media-calendar-month-view.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn81@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-22-25-079_7d00700896f17a6c.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/social-media-calendar-twitter-updates.png?width=669&height=296&name=social-media-calendar-twitter-updates.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn74@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-22-24-928_ce0511f1fed07ad1.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/social-media-calendar-facebook-updates.png?width=669&height=304&name=social-media-calendar-facebook-updates.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn94@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-22-28-539_07245d8e730a20df.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/social-media-calendar-linkedin-updates.png?width=669&height=227&name=social-media-calendar-linkedin-updates.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn86@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-22-27-601_631c08300d61d1fe.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/social-media-calendar-instagram-updates.png?width=669&height=187&name=social-media-calendar-instagram-updates.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn27@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-22-19-947_04f3c97e99e56140.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/social-media-calendar-pinterest-updates.png?width=669&height=246&name=social-media-calendar-pinterest-updates.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn90@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-22-25-823_936d284f402305c8.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/social-media-calendar-content-repository.png?width=669&height=146&name=social-media-calendar-content-repository.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn44@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-22-19-956_89718392f4e99aed.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fblog%2Ftabid%2F6307%2Fbid%2F33415%2Fthe-social-media-publishing-schedule-every-marketer-needs-template.aspx&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn10@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-22-28-664_0003b1a836e6591f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598311336432},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","title":"The Top Benefits of Marketing Automation","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-automation-benefits","description":"<p>For some reason, whenever I hear the words \"marketing automation,\" I think of the \"<a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transformers_(film)\">Transformers</a>\" movie with Shia LaBeouf and Megan Fox.</p> \n<p>It makes me think of the <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autobot\">Autobots</a> doing all our marketing -- which would be pretty cool.</p>  \n<p>But today, we're not going to be talking about the robots from Cybertron.</p> \n<p>Instead, let's focus on how marketing automation can benefit your business. Marketing automation is the process of making systems or processes occur automatically within a software.</p> \n<p>Essentially, marketing automation can help streamline your marketing efforts and make your department more efficient.</p> \n<p>In today's post, let's review the top benefits of marketing automation.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h3>1. Efficiency.</h3> \n<p>First and foremost, marketing automation makes your entire department more efficient. You can potentially reduce staffing costs while freeing up your team's time to work on more important, strategic projects.</p> \n<p>Instead of manually posting on social media every day, marketing automation software can automate that process.</p> \n<p>This means that your team can do more creative work, like planning and brainstorming for upcoming campaigns and projects.</p> \n<p>Additionally, working in an automation platform will make your team's tasks easier. Your staff can post on social media, create an email nurturing campaign, post a blog, or create a landing page all in the same software. Ultimately, this saves your team time when you're creating campaigns.</p> \n<h3>2. Marketing and sales alignment.</h3> \n<p>If you combine your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/crm-marketing-automation\">sales and marketing automation</a> efforts by using the same software, you'll be able to align company goals and efforts.</p> \n<p>Essentially, it'll make the process of going from <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/sales-qualified-lead\">marketing qualified lead to sales qualified lead</a> that much easier.</p> \n<p>In fact, <a href=\"https://www.invespcro.com/blog/marketing-automation/\">marketing automation can lead to a 14.5% increase in sales productivity and a 12.2% reduction in marketing overhead</a>.</p> \n<p>Plus, it can also help you generate more leads and increase sales. Your marketing team will spend more time strategizing ways to increase conversion rate, while your sales team increases productivity. It's a win-win.</p> \n<h3>3. Increase conversion rate.</h3> \n<p>Speaking of increasing conversion rates, marketing automation can also make your team more effective.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-automation-software-tools\">Marketing automation software</a> can help you increase your conversion rate and manage your leads more efficiently.</p> \n<p>Your marketing automation software will track your leads and you can even use it to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/retargeting-campaigns-beginner-guide\">retarget</a> your website visitors who don't convert, increasing your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/conversion-rate-optimization-guide\">CRO</a>.</p> \n<p>Again, marketing automation should give your team more time to analyze your marketing strategy and consider how to get visitors to convert.</p> \n<h3>4. Accurate reporting.</h3> \n<p>Reporting your analytics can seem like a daunting process, but with <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-automation-ecommerce\">marketing automation platforms</a>, it doesn't have to be.</p> \n<p>You should be able to use your software to generate automated reports. All of a sudden, a cumbersome task is simplified.</p> \n<p>Additionally, marketing automation platforms can give you a high-level overview of your overall process. This will help you see complications and friction points. With accurate, streamlined reporting you can see where things are going wrong.</p> \n<p>Do leads drop off during your lead nurturing email campaigns? Or is it during your sales process? Either way, accurate analytics will help you spot those points and fix them in a timely manner.</p> \n<h3>5. Personalized marketing strategy.</h3> \n<p>As your team spends more time creating instead of doing manual data entry, marketing automation software will allow them to create more personalized content through its segmentation capabilities and reporting.</p> \n<p>With marketing automation, you can target your persona on multiple channels. You can target them on social media, with search ads, or through email campaigns.</p> \n<p>How does marketing automation facilitate this?</p> \n<p>Well, marketing automation turns your web visitors into leads and once you know who your leads are, you can segment them by behavior or characteristics.</p> \n<p>The entire lead nurturing process should be personalized -- did someone read a post about sales conferences? Maybe your lead nurturing email invites them to a sales conference your team is hosting.</p> \n<p>This way your leads get personalized messaging and you can track their engagement. This will also help with lead scoring.</p> \n<h3>6. Lead scoring.</h3> \n<p>Marketing automation software can set up lead scoring for your team which will notify your sales team when a lead goes from marketing qualified lead to a sales qualified lead.</p> \n<p>Again, this speaks to the better alignment between your marketing and sales teams. Plus, it automates the process, which makes it easier and in real-time. This means no time is wasted and your sales team can reach out to prospects immediately.</p> \n<h3>7. Data management.</h3> \n<p>Not to repeat myself, but marketing automation platforms will keep track of your leads and their engagement with your site.</p> \n<p>That means that managing your data is easier than ever. Plus, it keeps your data up to date automatically.</p> \n<h3>8. Scalable processes.</h3> \n<p>Whenever you set up your marketing systems and processes, it's important to keep scale in mind. Can this process grow with your company? If it's not scalable, then it will be hard for your company to expand.</p> \n<p>Marketing automation will help you create processes that are scalable. The more manual a process is and the more it depends on one person, the harder it'll be to scale when the team grows.</p> \n<h3>9. Lead nurturing.</h3> \n<p>Last but not least, marketing automation makes <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/7-effective-lead-nurturing-tactics\">lead nurturing</a> possible. Marketing automation software is the place you'll create drip email campaigns and track their success.</p> \n<p>Without lead nurturing, you'll have a harder time converting leads to sales prospects.</p> \n<p>Now, it's not just me who promotes marketing automation. <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Optimus_Prime\">Optimus Prime</a> actually believes that marketing automation is one of the best ways to create a marketing program that will grow with your company. Plus, it can even align other departments like sales and customer service.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fmarketing-automation-benefits&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 19 Aug 2020 08:30:00 +0000","feedId":7159,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"86f455142ebe755c4bf0d7be6725cb59","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Rebecca Riserbato","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fmarketing-automation-benefits&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn44@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-22-20-020_f8c57211ab218228.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598311336425},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","title":"The Ultimate Guide to Social Media Analytics","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-analytics","description":"<p>There are over <a href=\"https://wearesocial.com/blog/2020/01/digital-2020-3-8-billion-people-use-social-media\">3.8 billion social media users</a> across the globe.</p> \n<p>As you can probably imagine, that’s a major reason why businesses want to be active on social, too. Businesses use social media to market, sell, and provide support to their target audience and customers as well as learn about and bond with them.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>The key is to understand what types of posts on which platforms are most effective in resonating with these audience members and customers.</p> \n<p>This will allow your business to consistently produce engaging content that positively impacts your bottom line.</p> \n<p>How do you do this? Well, it requires social media analytics and reporting.</p> \n<div class=\"CmABtb RNfche\"> \n <div class=\"CmABtb-bN97Pc-sM5MNb\"> \n  <div class=\"CmABtb-YPqjbf-sM5MNb\"> \n   <div class=\"notranslate IZ65Hb-YPqjbf fmcmS-x3Eknd CmABtb-YPqjbf\"></div> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</div> \n<a></a> \n<h2>What is social media analytics?</h2> \n<p><a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/features/social-media-analytics/\">Social media analytics</a> is the process of gathering and analyzing data and reports based on metrics from one or multiple social media accounts.</p> \n<p>Social media analytics provides insight into a number of important factors that are directly tied to the success of your marketing efforts and your business as a whole.</p> \n<p>Here’s a list that explains the <strong>importance of social media analytics:</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Develop a deeper understanding of who your target audience is and where they spend their time</li> \n <li>Identify which social platforms receive the greatest amount of traffic</li> \n <li>Determine what type of social content leads to the most conversions, engagements, etc.</li> \n <li>Discover what type of social media post has the greatest reach and resonates best with your audience on certain platforms</li> \n <li>Learn about what is and isn’t working in terms of social media campaigns and ads among your audience while they’re live and after they wrap up</li> \n <li>Develop a stronger social media strategy for your business’s specific goals related to things like your marketing, sales, and service efforts</li> \n</ul> \n<a></a> \n<h2>Social Media Analytics Reports</h2> \n<p>Social media analytics reports provide an overview of specific metrics and data points — such as engagements and impressions — related to the content you share on various social media platforms. Simply put, reports are how you’ll review your social media analytics.</p> \n<p>Social media analytics tools (<a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-analytics#social-media-analytics-tools\">which we’ll review next</a>) make the creation of reports simple — some of these resources provide reports from one social platform at a time while others provide reports from multiple social platforms.</p> \n<p>Either way, social media analytics reporting tools are typically customizable — meaning, you can view and pull the data and reports that matter most to you and your business.</p> \n<p>With the tools we’re going to review below, reports can be automatically made and shared for you. But, here are some of the unique <strong>aspects of social media analytics reports</strong> that you can typically customize:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Statistics and data points that matter to you and will be displayed in the report</li> \n <li>Time frame (weekly, monthly, quarterly, yearly, campaign start to end)</li> \n <li>Progress growth (i.e. how you’ll share your progress growth over time through a report — typically, either in the form of a snapshot or a comparison of stats in a given time period).</li> \n</ul> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/social-media-roi-monthly-report?hubs_post-cta=pillar_allphrase&amp;_ga=2.202530578.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Learn how to create impactful monthly reports to show ROI on your social media efforts.</a></p> \n<p>As stated, your reports will be unique based on the analytics software or tool you use. However, let’s look at some of the most common social media analytics reports that you may come across or create at some point.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Types of Social Media Analytics Reports</h3> \n<p>To give you an idea of some of the different types of social media analytics reports available in commonly-used tools, let’s look at <a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/social/analyze-social-reports?_ga=2.202530578.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\">HubSpot’s social media analytics reporting options</a>.</p> \n<h4>1. Audience Analytics Report</h4> \n<div> \n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-3.png?width=1500&amp;name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-3.png\" alt=\"audience social media analytics report\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"> </img>\n</div> \n<p>The Audience report displays your current number of followers for each of your social accounts compared to the number of followers you had in a previous time period.</p> \n<h4>2. Published Posts Analytics Report</h4> \n<div> \n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020.png?width=1500&amp;name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020.png\" alt=\"published posts social media analytics report\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"> </img>\n</div> \n<p>The Published Posts report shows the number of social posts published across your social accounts during a specific time period.</p> \n<h4>3. Interactions Analytics Report</h4> \n<div> \n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-6.png?width=1500&amp;name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-6.png\" alt=\"interactions social media analytics report\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"> </img>\n</div> \n<p>The Interactions report displays the number of likes, reactions, and comments on all of your posts across multiple platforms.</p> \n<h4>4. Clicks Analytics Report</h4> \n<div> \n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-1.png?width=1500&amp;name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-1.png\" alt=\"clicks social media analytics report\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"> </img>\n</div> \n<p>The Clicks report displays how many clicks you get on your social posts published through HubSpot.</p> \n<h4>5. Shares Analytics Report</h4> \n<div> \n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-7.png?width=1500&amp;name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-7.png\" alt=\"shares social media analytics report\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"> </img>\n</div> \n<p>The Shares report displays the amount of your posts that were shared by your audience members.</p> \n<h4>6. Impressions Analytics Report</h4> \n<div> \n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-4.png?width=1500&amp;name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-4.png\" alt=\"impressions social media analytics report\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"> </img>\n</div> \n<p>The Impressions report shows the number of views that posts on your LinkedIn, Facebook, and Instagram pages received.</p> \n<h4>7. Sessions Analytics Report</h4> \n<div> \n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-2.png?width=1500&amp;name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-2.png\" alt=\"sessions social media analytics report\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"> </img>\n</div> \n<p>The Sessions report displays how many web sessions took place within a given time period on your site that were driven from social media.</p> \n<h4>8. New Contacts Analytics Report</h4> \n<div> \n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-5.png?width=1500&amp;name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-5.png\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"new contacts social media analytics report\"> </img>\n</div> \n<p>The New Contacts report displays how many new contacts have been created in HubSpot as a result of web sessions driven from social media within the selected time period.</p> \n<p>Now you may be wondering what tools are available to help you pull these reports and data — next, we’ll cover some of your options.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2>Social Media Analytics Tools</h2> \n<p>There are a plethora of social media analytics tools available today which is why identifying the right one for your business can seem like a daunting task. We’ve compiled the following list of seven of our favorites to help get you started.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/social-media-templates?hubs_post-cta=pillar_allphrase&amp;_ga=2.248025092.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Download 10 free social media templates to help you manage and optimize your content to achieve the best results.</a></p> \n<h3>1. HubSpot Social Media Software</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/social-inbox?_ga=2.248025092.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\">HubSpot Social Media Software</a> gives you insight into the customer journey through integrated analytics tools. These help you understand which of your marketing tactics are working best among your audience, determine how your marketing efforts are impacting your bottom line, and learn about your search engine optimization (SEO)-related ROI.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/free-trial-social-media-tools?hubs_post-cta=pillar_allphrase&amp;_ga=2.248025092.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Try HubSpot's social media tools free for 30 days</a><span style=\"font-style: italic;\">.</span></p> \n<p>In addition to this HubSpot’s Social Media Software, there are <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/resources/social-media?_ga=2.248025092.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\">a number of resources</a> including social media analytics report templates, free social media analytics tools, and <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/resources/courses/social-media?_ga=2.248025092.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\">social media courses</a> available for you to implement in your strategy.</p> \n<p><strong>Note</strong>: HubSpot also integrates with other analytics software, like <a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/social-media/oktopost?_ga=2.248025092.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\">Oktopost</a>, as well as major social platforms and their respective analytics tools such as <a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/social-media/linkedin?_ga=2.84646170.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/social-media/facebook?_ga=2.84646170.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\">Facebook</a>, <a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/social-media/instagram?_ga=2.84646170.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\">Instagram</a>, and <a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/social-media/youtube?_ga=2.84646170.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\">Youtube</a> (among many others, which you can learn about in the HubSpot integrations <a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/analytics-data?_ga=2.84646170.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\">marketplace</a>).</p> \n<h3>2. TweetDeck</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://tweetdeck.twitter.com/\">TweetDeck</a> is an analytics tool used for Twitter. It works in real-time to help you view and analyze your Tweet engagement, organization, management, and tracking on the platform.</p> \n<h3>3. Tweet Reach</h3> \n<p>Despite what you may think based on its name, <a href=\"https://tweetreach.com/\">Tweet Reach</a>&nbsp;isn’t just used for Twitter. The analytics tool creates snapshot reports to help you efficiently monitor and pull key takeaways from your Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook profiles based on factors you identify as most important to your business.</p> \n<h3>4. Buffer</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://buffer.com/analyze\">Buffer</a> provides an in-depth look at how you can strategize to grow your brand on social media. The software does this by measuring your performance on various social platforms, creating detailed reports about the data points that matter to you, and recommending ways to improve your reach, engagement, and more.</p> \n<h3>5. Hootsuite</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://hootsuite.com/platform/analytics\">Hootsuite</a> allows you to create customized social media reports using over 200 metrics over any of your social channels and campaigns. These reports are easily shareable with members of your team as well as your clients to keep everyone on the same page and prove ROI.</p> \n<h3>6. Sprout Social</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/analytics-and-social-listening/\">Sprout Social</a> provides a look into the needs of your customers through the conversations your customers and followers are having on social. The software also measures your specific content and campaign work across various platforms and channels to determine what’s working best among audience members and what should be improved upon.</p> \n<p>(Note: Sprout Social is another social media software that <a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/social-media/sprout-social?_ga=2.84646170.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\">integrates with HubSpot</a>.)</p> \n<h3>7. Mention</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://mention.com/en/\">Mention</a> is a tool that allows your company to monitor, listen, and analyze your posts as well as your interactions with and among audience members via different social channels and platforms. The software also makes it easy to create automated reports to share this data with fellow employees or clients.</p> \n<p>Next, let’s look at how to apply these tools and resources in your day-to-day work by reviewing the steps involved in tracking social media analytics (also known as your <strong>social media analytics strategy</strong>).</p> \n<a></a> \n<p>Work through the following steps to begin tracking your social media analytics and gaining a better understanding of which parts of your processes are working and which need to be modified. Again, you can think of this as your social media analytics strategy.</p> \n<h3>1. Set SMART social media analytics goals.</h3> \n<p>Create and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-write-a-smart-goal-template?_ga=2.81024276.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\">set SMART goals</a> to help you achieve your social media analytics goals. By ensuring your goals are SMART, they’ll be Specific, Measureable, Attainable, Relevant, and Time-bound — meaning, you’ll be able to focus your strategy to reach or even exceed your expectations efficiently.</p> \n<p>To begin, ask yourself, “What do I want to learn from my social media analytics?” Then, dive into each part of the SMART goal. Here’s an example of a SMART goal related to your social media analytics strategy for reference.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-determine-your-smart-marketing-goals?hubs_post-cta=pillar_allphrase&amp;_ga=2.81024276.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Use a free template to help you create SMART goals and achieve them</a><span style=\"font-style: italic;\">.</span></p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Specific:</strong> I want to use social media analytics to identify specific data points related to my marketing tactics to determine which posts and campaigns are working best in reaching and engaging our audience members.</li> \n <li><strong>Measurable:</strong> I want to be able to identify some specific data points to accomplish this goal.</li> \n <li><strong>Attainable: </strong>I will work to identify <em>three</em> specific data points to help accomplish this goal.</li> \n <li><strong>Relevant:</strong> These data points will help my team and I measure our success in reaching and engaging our audience members across social media channels as well as identify any gaps or areas for improvement in our social media strategy.</li> \n <li><strong>Time-bound:</strong> I want to identify these specific data points over the course of the next month — this way, in four week’s time, we can begin using them to measure our success in reaching and engaging audience members across social channels and identify gaps and areas for improvement in our social media strategy.</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>2. Decide which metrics you’ll and focus on and track.</h3> \n<p>Now it’s time to decide which <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-metrics-ceos-cares-about?_ga=2.81024276.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\">social media metrics</a> you’re going to track. There are a number of commonly-tracked social media metrics for your consideration. Metrics may vary by social platform as well as which analytics tool you chose. But, here are some all-encompassing metrics applicable to virtually every social channel and analytics tool to get started.</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Reach</strong> is the total number of people who have seen your content.</li> \n <li><strong>Engagements</strong> are all interactions including shares, likes, and comments.</li> \n <li><strong>Impressions</strong> are the number of times or content is displayed on someone’s feed.</li> \n <li><strong>Mentions</strong> are the times your business and brand are referenced on social media by audience members or other businesses.</li> \n <li><strong>Social ROI</strong> provides insight into whether the investment you've put into your social media marketing is resulting in an increase or decrease in customers, sales, brand awareness, and customer loyalty.</li> \n <li><strong>Social listening</strong> is when you monitor conversations about your business and brand on social to see what customers and audience members are saying about you.</li> \n <li><strong>Likes</strong> are when an audience member taps (or double taps) on your social content to show they’re a fan of your post.</li> \n <li><strong>Retweets/shares/reposts</strong> are when audience members post the content your business published on their profiles.</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>3. Determine which social media analytics tools you’ll use.</h3> \n<p>Next, determine which social media analytics tools you’ll use — <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-analytics#social-media-analytics-tools\">we covered some popular choices above</a> but you can always review other options through a simple Google search.</p> \n<p>Before making a decision regarding which tool or tools you’ll use, think about the following questions:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Do you want a tool or software to help you manage your social media analytics across multiple channels and platforms (e.g. Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn) or just one (e.g. Twitter)?</li> \n <li>Which metrics did you decide you’re going to track (as we touched on in the above step)?</li> \n <li>What is your budget? Do you need a tool with flexible pricing options and features that you can add to or remove from over time? (To find this information, review the pricing pages like <a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/pricing/\">this page on Sprout Social’s website</a>.)</li> \n <li>Which tools and software options are suited to help you achieve the SMART goals you set? (Check out feature pages for this type of information, like <a href=\"https://www.oktopost.com/platform/social-media-analytics\">this page on Oktopost’s website</a>.)</li> \n <li>Do you want your tool to integrate with the greater software your team uses to run your business (such as <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm?_ga=2.81024276.2097981921.1583513905-1675356138.1572978608\">HubSpot’s CRM</a>, for example)?</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>4. Measure the success of your social media analytics efforts.</h3> \n<p>Once you implement your social media analytics software, you’ll be able to measure the success of your efforts. To do this, you may use the analytics tool you implemented — depending on your software, you might have the ability to create customized reports and dashboards or pull the specific details about data points you care most about.</p> \n<p>In addition to applying your tools to help measure your success, you may also consider your answers to the following questions:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Did you achieve your SMART goals?</li> \n <li>Did the metrics you chose to focus on tell a story that’s helpful for your business?</li> \n <li>Did the software or tool you implemented support your business needs?</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>5. Make necessary social media analytics adjustments.</h3> \n<p>Once you measure the success of your social media analytics efforts, you’ll be able to determine whether or not any part of your strategy needs to be changed or updated.</p> \n<p>Maybe you realize one of your data points isn’t providing the level of insight into your marketing efforts across social platforms, so you need to identify a new one to measure. Maybe your software doesn’t allow you to customize cross-channel reports the way you want to, so you need to implement a new tool. Or, if you’re happy with the way your social media analytics reporting and strategy is working, be sure to revisit your strategy in the future to ensure it continues meeting your expectations.</p> \n<h2>Begin Tracking and Applying Social Media Analytics</h2> \n<p>By tracking and applying the process of social media analytics to your strategy, you’ll be able to more effectively reach your audience. And when you do this, you’ll see improvements in factors that are directly tied to your ROI like engagement, conversions, loyalty, and more.</p> \n<p>Consider which tools and software are best for you and determine how you’ll track your social media analytics to create deeper relationships with your customers and followers.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in March 2020 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p> \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fsocial-media-analytics&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" Baker)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-3.png?width=1500&name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn23@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-22-21-006_1d782f113eca95aa.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020.png?width=1500&name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn38@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-22-27-011_fc3252e85145593e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-6.png?width=1500&name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-6.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn37@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-22-21-923_70ebf99985e0356e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-1.png?width=1500&name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn57@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-22-28-253_fd9455e5805de46a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-7.png?width=1500&name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-7.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn41@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-22-25-461_81b47f533599e210.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-4.png?width=1500&name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-4.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn62@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-22-25-572_08ba614e6441388f.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-2.png?width=1500&name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn89@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-22-26-730_f5ec5772b9991c12.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-5.png?width=1500&name=Social%20Media%20Analytics%20%E2%80%94%20NNP%20Pillar,%20Marketing%20Blog,%20SIR%20Q1%2020-5.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn86@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-22-23-033_6b181701877c58e4.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fsocial-media-analytics&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn24@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-22-20-017_2bc87f19a7f351dd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598311336429},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","title":"What's an Implementation Partner & How Do You Work With One?","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/implementation-partner","description":"<p>In college, I took a class on graphic design. One requirement for the class was to have working knowledge of Adobe. Since most of us in the class had no idea how to use Adobe's expansive design suite, my school invited an implementation partner to visit and show us the ropes.</p>  \n<p>Someone from the partnering agency came to our class and demonstrated how to use the tools we had for InDesign to maximize our success in the class. I loved this presentation because it was created just for our group — the presenter polled us about what we wanted to learn and delivered relevant information based on that feedback.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>I would've definitely struggled with using the software had it not been for the agency partner. I loved the experience, and it gave me an understanding of just how amazing implementation partners can be for the companies they support.</p> \n<p>Implementation partners work directly with your customers to ensure they're getting the most out of your product. You can think of an implementation partner in the same way you think about tech support. Often, tech support agents are certified by the company they work for to give actionable solutions for problems.</p> \n<p>The difference between tech support and implementation partners is that the latter can benefit from an increase in <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/brand-awareness?_ga=2.81757138.434658601.1597805933-940436819.1565181751\">brand awareness</a> and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/beginner-inbound-lead-generation-guide-ht?_ga=2.81757138.434658601.1597805933-940436819.1565181751\">leads</a>. If you work with them, you can offer their services to those who might need help with your tools past onboarding.</p> \n<p>If you offer software that takes time to implement and learn, like a <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/cms?_ga=2.15763699.434658601.1597805933-940436819.1565181751\">CMS</a>, you might look into working with implementation partners. They would be separate from the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/customer-onboarding?_ga=2.15763699.434658601.1597805933-940436819.1565181751\">onboarding team</a> you already have set in place. Their focus would be to give an in-depth training about your product, designed just for that customer.</p> \n<p>You might use implementation partners if you want to offer consumers alternate methods to learn how to use your technology. Implementation partners have the bandwidth parent companies may not have when offering personalized solutions. In other words, a \"do-it-for-me\" approach is more feasible with partners.</p> \n<p>For customers, implementation partners can be a cost-effective solution for selecting and understanding your services. If you charge an onboarding fee some can't afford, for instance, partners with lower overhead may offer lower prices. This way, you wouldn't miss out on a customer with a more restrictive budget and can be assured they're getting a proper onboarding experience.</p> \n<p>Additionally, some partners can handle larger customers, and they can meet customer needs as your business scales. For instance, one of <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/agencies?_ga=2.15763699.434658601.1597805933-940436819.1565181751\">HubSpot's agency partners</a>, <a href=\"https://impact.com/\">IMPACT</a>, specializes in helping large teams acclimate to their software. They offer an interactive training program that's designed specifically for the business they're working with.</p> \n<p>So, that's what implementation partners are — now let's talk about how to work with them.</p> \n<h2>How to Work With Implementation Partners</h2> \n<p>The relationship your company has with implementation agencies should be mutually beneficial. The agency can look forward to more work and customers. Additionally, customers will have multiple onboarding options, some at lower costs, to your benefit. Let's talk about how to maximize your relationship with partners.</p> \n<h3>1. Set up a program or process for partnerships.</h3> \n<p>HubSpot has an implementation program called <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/partners/solutions?_ga=2.15763699.434658601.1597805933-940436819.1565181751\">Solutions Partners</a>. Agencies proficient in HubSpot's offerings can apply to be a partner and have their website listed on the <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/agencies?_ga=2.85806684.434658601.1597805933-940436819.1565181751\">Agencies</a> page. This page is where HubSpot customers go to locate outside help with implementation, social strategy, and more.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Whats%20an%20Implementation%20Partner%20%26%20How%20Do%20You%20Work%20With%20One%3F.png\" alt=\"\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><span style=\"font-family: 'times new roman', times;\"><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/agencies\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>Consider creating a similar program that facilitates focused and organized agreements. You'll already know what you're looking for in an agency, as well as what you intend to get out of the partnership.</p> \n<p>Keep the purpose of the program in mind during the design process. Choose agencies that honor this goal. In addition, outline what your company can offer the agency. For instance, HubSpot partners can enjoy a website feature, a space for reviews, and the approval from the company as a valued source for onboarding.</p> \n<h3>2. Identify co-marketing opportunities with prospects.</h3> \n<p>When you begin to look for prospective partners, identify<a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/34188/what-in-the-heck-is-co-marketing.aspx?_ga=2.85806684.434658601.1597805933-940436819.1565181751\"> co-marketing opportunities</a>.</p> \n<p>This is because partners can enjoy the chance to win awards for their work. Agencies can display awards, tiers, or badges on their websites as well as company-approved program designs.</p> \n<p>Consider similar co-marketing ideas as you search and select partners. Communicate how all parties can benefit. For incentives, you can give awards based on success, offer quotes for webpages, and even launch a new onboarding process.</p> \n<p>For example, if there's an agency in your network that's pioneered a revolutionary method in onboarding customers, debut a joint campaign to generate more leads and interest in the program.</p> \n<h3>3. Make sure agencies are well-versed in your product.</h3> \n<p>This seems like a no-brainer, but it's critical to partner with agencies whose teams are experts in your product(s). If your company offers a certification course, you can make that a requirement in the application process.</p> \n<p>You can also make it a requirement for agencies to have a certain level of success using your offerings. For instance, if you offer a CMS, you can set the expectation that agencies who have at least 500 customers can apply to help SMB customers.</p> \n<p>Make sure your method gives agencies a clearly defined way to show their expertise with your product. Look for their knowledge of offerings, mission, and vision, in tandem with their know-how. Remember, agencies should deliver an experience on-par with your company’s own offering.</p> \n<h3>4. Have an easy application process.</h3> \n<p>Even though you should be selective with approving partners, it's important to make your process accessible. Make the application flexible so every interested agency can show their work. You might find a rockstar partnership that way.</p> \n<p>For instance, at some companies, all agencies need is proof of previous success and experience with the software. From there, they can expect a short interview period.</p> \n<p>An easy application process will also be able to scale as your business grows. A two-step application is easier to manage as your company acquires more leads and broader goals. In addition, agencies that are interested in partnering with your company might be more inclined to apply if the steps are simple.</p> \n<h3>5. Make sure agencies can deliver highly technical solutions.</h3> \n<p>Agencies should be well-versed in the product <em>and</em> capable of delivering solutions. Solutions, in this realm, generally come in two forms: Results-driven, and those that are technical.</p> \n<p>In the results-driven category, implementation partners need to locate where customers are having problems with the software, then identify solutions. For instance, if a company can't figure out how to use workflows to organize leads, the agency should be able to identify that, then show customers a fix that maximizes their software.</p> \n<p>Fixing that workflow should improve organization between members of the team and drive growth for the customer.</p> \n<p>On the other hand, maybe a customer can't figure out how to download a necessary extension. Agencies should have the know-how to lead customers toward the answer.</p> \n<p>If your company offers a certification, consider whether it’s intensive enough for an agency application point. And consider developing a new course that covers the extra material companies should know about in order to be a successful partner.</p> \n<p>Alternatively, develop a test or video challenge agencies must complete. At HubSpot, partners specializing in <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/sales?_ga=2.10322160.434658601.1597805933-940436819.1565181751\">Sales Hub</a> have to upload a video that shows proof of a highly-technical, results-driven solution. Consider developing a case study agencies must complete to apply.</p> \n<p>Make sure your method for partnerships accurately demonstrates the agencies' expertise with your product. For example, a five-question quiz might not be the best route, but an <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/quiz-maker?_ga=2.10322160.434658601.1597805933-940436819.1565181751\">interactive test</a> could be better. A test could tap into each area of your software, and the interactive elements would give agencies the chance to put their own spin on your questions.</p> \n<p>Implementation partners are an amazing way to grow the network within your business. You can begin to foster an ecosystem of users with agencies that help onboard customers. Agencies should have the capabilities to adapt to the way your company sells and serves customers — kind of like the gift that keeps on giving.</p> \n<p>If you're interested in starting a partner program, you're all set to begin. Don't forget to keep your customers at the core of your planning, and you'll make extremely valuable partnerships that can help your business grow. Good luck, and happy onboarding.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fimplementation-partner&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" +0000","feedId":7159,"bgimg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Whats%20an%20Implementation%20Partner%20%26%20How%20Do%20You%20Work%20With%20One%3F.png","linkMd5":"2ee6f405d7b7cb7395752dd983825a92","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn68@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-22-16-746_c5d9df7adf736afb.webp","destWidth":1206,"destHeight":716,"sourceBytes":100314,"destBytes":100314,"author":"Kayla Carmicheal","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Whats%20an%20Implementation%20Partner%20%26%20How%20Do%20You%20Work%20With%20One%3F.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn68@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-22-16-746_c5d9df7adf736afb.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fimplementation-partner&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn4@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-22-20-054_fcf3e71cd71746f2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598311336425},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","title":"Instagram Influencer Marketing Myths, Debunked","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-influencer-myths","description":"<p>Growing up for me, becoming an influencer wasn't a job someone could aspire to be.</p> \n<p>But nowadays, it's a job that kids dream of and an industry that impacts young adults purchasing decisions.</p> \n<p>In fact, <a href=\"https://www.emarketer.com/content/influencers-more-likely-to-inspire-gen-zer-and-millennial-purchases\">in 2019 22% of Gen Z, 20% of millennials, and 16% of Gen X have made a purchase inspired by an influencer post on social media</a>.</p>  \n<p>At this point, you might be wondering, <em>\"What's an influencer?\"</em></p> \n<p>According to <a href=\"https://influencermarketinghub.com/what-is-an-influencer/\">Influencer Marketing Hub</a>, \"An influencer is someone who has the power to affect the purchasing decisions of others because of their authority, knowledge, position, or relationship with their audience.\"</p> \n<p>On the other hand, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/andrewdelaney/\">Andrew Delaney</a>, a senior manager on the HubSpot social media team, says, \"We are all influencers every time we choose to post. We could be suggesting or recommending a location, a business, an item, or another person by taking the action of sharing that content in the first place. In each of these instances, we are influential, even when we are not trying to directly influence.\"</p> \n<p>The <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-work-with-influencers\">influencer industry</a> has been around for over a decade now, and a lot of myths about the industry have circulated in that time.</p> \n<p>In this post, let's review the top influencer marketing myths that have been debunked.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h3>1. Influencer marketing is diminishing in popularity.</h3> \n<p>When social media first came on the scene, a lot of old-school businesses were hesitant to adopt it as a major marketing tactic. The influencer industry has been no different.</p> \n<p>Many organizations haven't adopted influencer marketing in their ongoing marketing strategy because they think it's a fad that will diminish in popularity.</p> \n<p>However, that isn't correct.</p> \n<p>In 2018 alone there were <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/marketing-statistics\">3.7 million brand-sponsored influencer posts on Instagram</a>.</p> \n<p>Additionally, <a href=\"https://digitalmarketinginstitute.com/en-us/blog/20-influencer-marketing-statistics-that-will-surprise-you\">49% of consumers</a> today depend on influencer recommendations for their purchase decisions. <a href=\"https://digitalmarketinginstitute.com/en-us/blog/20-influencer-marketing-statistics-that-will-surprise-you#\">60%</a> say they've been influenced by a recommendation when shopping in-store.</p> \n<p>According to <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/krystalwu/\">Krystal Wu</a>, a social media community manager at HubSpot, \"The Instagram influencer marketing trend is not and will not, in the near future be canceled. With businesses relying more on social media, now more than ever, influencer marketing is helping businesses reach larger audiences.\"</p> \n<p>She added, \"Think about it like this -- influencers on Instagram are the new model examples on how products wear, work, function, and are used rather than in-store experiences.\"</p> \n<h3>2. You shouldn't use smaller accounts.</h3> \n<p>One of the most prominent myths of influencer marketing is that you need to use large accounts to see results.</p> \n<p>However, the opposite is often true.</p> \n<p>While <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/micro-influencer-marketing\">micro-influencers</a> seem like a small player in the influencer marketing game, in a recent study, <a href=\"https://www.marketingdive.com/news/micro-influencers-have-major-impact-on-buying-behavior-study/416579/\">82% of respondents</a> said they were \"highly likely to follow a micro-influencers' recommendation.\"</p> \n<p>So, how does this work in practice?</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/nicoleperegrina/\">Nicole Acosta</a>, a social media and marketing manager at <a href=\"https://www.ironphysicaltherapy.com/\">Iron Physical Therapy</a> and <a href=\"https://www.thomasedison.org/\">Edison Innovation Foundation</a>, says, \"Instagram influencers don't have to have a huge following to be effective. They only need an engaged following.\"</p> \n<p>This means that you don't have to spend a large amount of money on your influencer marketing.</p> \n<p>Acosta added, \"Choose people who may not have hundreds of thousands of followers but have clear authority in their niche because their followers will trust their opinion and engage more with the content they make for you (which is the whole point!).\"</p> \n<p>Another expert, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/raquelswan/\">Raquel Swan</a>, agreed with Acosta's assessment.</p> \n<p>Swan, a social media coordinator at <a href=\"https://digitalstandout.com/\">Digital Standout</a>, says, \"Brands need to carefully select their influencers and ensure that the followers and the influencers relate to the product or service offering to have a successful marketing campaign.\"</p> \n<p>HubSpot's social media campaign manager, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/author/leslie-green\">Leslie Green</a>, concurred.</p> \n<p>Green says, \"Partnering with an influencer with tons of followers doesn't guarantee tons of sales. Don't breeze over the power of nano-influencers who have built meaningful relationships with their audience and are incredible content creators and storytellers.\"</p> \n<p>The point here is that more followers don't always equal more sales. If the key performance indicator (KPI) is conversion, then you should look into using micro-influencers.</p> \n<p>\"The trust micro-influencers have fostered is way more valuable than you think. And in the end, everyone is an influencer. As a brand, it's so important to do your research and make sure the partnership makes sense for the audience and feels authentic to the influencer. Don't just become starry-eyed from a massive following,\" Green added.</p> \n<h3>3. Influencers will be hard to work with.</h3> \n<p>Another popular myth is that influencers aren't professional. Many people think they're shallow or untrustworthy.</p> \n<p>On the contrary, influencers are actually entrepreneurs and content creators whose reputation impacts their ability to make a living.</p> \n<p>Two digital content creators/influencers, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/kimiaskravings/\">Kimia Kalbasi</a> and <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/lordmartin_/\">Martin Tettey</a>, found this myth to be the most misleading.</p> \n<p>Kalbasi, founder/influencer at <a href=\"https://kimiaskravings.com/\">Kimia's Kravings</a>, says, \"A myth is that all influencers are shallow or disingenuous. There are people like that in all walks of life regardless of their job title but because influencers are at the forefront of social media, put themselves out there, and showcase their lifestyle, it's perceived otherwise. But they're human, too.\"</p> \n<p>Tettey, a <a href=\"https://www.martintettey.com/\">successful writer</a>, wears many hats. He's a client consultant at <a href=\"http://www.mccannworldgroup.com/\">McCann WorldGroup</a>, a co-chair of diversity &amp; inclusion at <a href=\"https://www.prsa.org/\">PRSA</a>, and a digital content creator on Instagram.</p> \n<p>He says, \"Influencers are often ridiculed as self-absorbed people who try to sell things they don't believe in when that's not always true. A vast majority of influencers gave up their full-time careers as architects or engineers to pursue a life worth creating according to their passions.\"</p> \n<p>Essentially, influencers are entrepreneurs and content creators.</p> \n<p>\"Many people, like myself, love food, interior design, and travel. The best way to create inspiration for others was to create a personal brand on social media and a blog that is fully aligned and dedicated to my passion and various creative journeys that inspire myself and many others,\" Tettey added.</p> \n<h3>4. You won't see results if you work with influencers.</h3> \n<p>The name of the game is ROI and you might be thinking that you won't see results if you work with influencers.</p> \n<p>However, <a href=\"https://mediakix.com/influencer-marketing-resources/influencer-marketing-industry-statistics-survey-benchmarks/#gs.cwtjta\">80% of marketers</a> say influencer marketing is effective, and 89% say it works just as well (if not better) than other marketing channels.</p> \n<p>You might deduce that when you're deciding on which marketing channels to use, it's important to consider influencer marketing.</p> \n<p>Almost <a href=\"http://www.ion.co/twitter-has-released-a-report-showing-consumers-seek-product-recommendations-from-influencers-almost-as-much-as-they-do-from-friends\">50% of customers</a> say they follow influencers' product or service recommendations.</p> \n<p>Additionally, according to HubSpot's <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/state-of-marketing\">Not Another State of Marketing Report</a>, over 10% of respondents said influencer posts are among the most successful content for engaging your social audience.</p> \n<h3>5. You won't get quality referrals from influencers.</h3> \n<p>Similar to the point above, many people inaccurately assume that referrals from influencers won't be qualified leads.</p> \n<p>However, <a href=\"http://mediakix.com/2019/02/influencer-marketing-effectiveness/#gs.cwxh8w\">70% of businesses</a> say the quality of traffic from influencers is better than from other sources.</p> \n<p>That's why it's important to look at influencer marketing when you're planning your marketing strategy for the year.</p> \n<h3>6. Success is hard to measure.</h3> \n<p>Calculating ROI is a major challenge in marketing. That's why people assume it's hard to measure success for influencer marketing as well.</p> \n<p>However, that's not exactly true.</p> \n<p>Influencer marketing can be measured with normal KPIs including engagement, conversion rate, and impressions.</p> \n<p>You could even run a brand awareness campaign. In fact, influencer marketing strategies focused on branding or engagements generate <a href=\"https://influencermarketinghub.com/influencer-marketing-2019-benchmark-report/\">8x the ROI</a>.</p> \n<h3>7. My industry won't do well with influencer marketing.</h3> \n<p>While you might think that influencer marketing is just for <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/examples-of-influencer-marketing-campaigns\">B2C companies</a> in the beauty or fashion industry, there are influencers for every niche.</p> \n<p>In fact, even <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-hubspot-uses-influencer-marketing\">a B2B company like HubSpot</a> uses influencer marketing.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/samantha-giedris-b5536511a/\">Samantha Giedris</a>, a social media and video specialist at <a href=\"https://frazerconsultants.com/\">Frazer Consultants</a>, says \"There are influencers in every industry, no matter how niche it is. So it's worth looking into who has influence in your industry even if they're not exactly who you'd typically think of as influencers.\"</p> \n<p>Additionally, it's important to consider influencer marketing as a strategy even if you don't think it's for you.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/diegosantossic/?locale=en_US\">Diego Santos</a>, a marketing manager at HubSpot, said in the <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/state-of-marketing\">Not Another State of Marketing Report</a>, \"Pay attention to private groups, micro-influencers and social movements that are relevant to your brand.\"</p> \n<h3>8. Influencer marketing isn't a legitimate form of marketing.</h3> \n<p>If I haven't convinced you yet, influencer marketing is a legitimate strategy, even if you've been guilty of believing this myth.</p> \n<p>In HubSpot's <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/state-of-marketing\">Not Another State of Marketing Report</a>, <a href=\"https://www.toprankblog.com/lee-odden/\">Lee Odden</a>, the CEO of <a href=\"https://www.toprankmarketing.com/\">TopRank Marketing</a>, is quoted saying, \"To win the content marketing game, brands need to focus more on optimized, personalized and influencer activated content experiences.\"</p> \n<p>If you haven't jumped on the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/influencer-marketing-power\">influencer marketing</a> bandwagon, it's probably time that you think about doing so. To start, you can create a strategy and brainstorm who the influencers are in your industry.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Finstagram-influencer-myths&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" Riserbato","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Finstagram-influencer-myths&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn82@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-22-27-549_709c82e05d85da82.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598311336426},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25
