\">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 12 Aug 2020 10:00:00 +0000","feedId":7159,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"f373e510d75d27250dedb78eda59f510","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Kayla Carmicheal","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-08-11%20at%2010.25.49%20AM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-08-11%20at%2010.25.49%20AM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn19@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-22-28-891_024b16a5c8dbca3c.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Buffer-on-Instagram-bio-example.png?width=1500&name=Buffer-on-Instagram-bio-example.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-22-29-656_c759d444446d1a82.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/metter%20media%20branding.png?width=1500&name=metter%20media%20branding.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn74@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-22-25-823_7259e27fb0fb7cd6.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/polling%20screenshot-1.png?width=359&name=polling%20screenshot-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn20@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-22-21-835_6dadeb86bb6f25fb.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/linkedin%20diversifying%20content%20example.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn53@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-22-27-525_8caeb84084caae37.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/totinos%20promotion.png?width=1500&name=totinos%20promotion.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn99@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-22-24-238_fa6572d5255d4eaa.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fdata-backed-social-media-marketing-tips&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn13@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-22-25-918_810569e6ddd4cb3a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598311336431},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","title":"Do AR Product Previews Actually Lead to Purchases [New Research]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ar-product-preview-data","description":"<p>According to a recent Retail Dive survey, <a href=\"https://www.retaildive.com/news/why-most-shoppers-still-choose-brick-and-mortar-stores-over-e-commerce/436068/\">55% of consumers</a> still prefer to shop in stores because they like to see or test out products before they buy them.</p>  \n<p>But, if consumers could see or try products virtually from home, would they still need to go to the store before making a purchase?</p> \n<p>This question has been asked by companies like <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/adlp/arview\">Amazon</a>, <a href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/2/4/18205654/warby-parker-ar-iphone-face-id-mapping-glasses-try-on-app\">Warby Parker</a>, and <a href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/ikea-place/id1279244498\">IKEA</a> which have embraced AR product reviews. With these previews, ecommerce visitors can see an item of clothing on a photo of their body, preview what furniture will look like in their bedroom, and even size themselves to ensure they're buying a product with the best fit.</p> \n<p>But is this virtual experience really as effective as a traditional store or fitting room at getting people to buy?</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Skeptics might say no. With AR being costly to implement and product viewings only requiring a physical store location, many marketers think that this technology isn't worth the fuss.</p> \n<p>However, as the world grows more and more digital, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/millennials-vs-gen-z\">each new generation</a> is making even more online purchases. They're also embracing technologies <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/emerging-technology-stats\">like AR/VR for entertainment or retail purposes</a>.</p> \n<p>Not to mention, while holidays like <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/black-friday-ads\">Black Friday</a> cause a burst in foot-traffic, retail businesses are finding it more challenging to keep people coming into stores throughout the rest of the year.</p> \n<p>While AR might have been inaccessible to retail marketers in the past, could it be a revenue-generating opportunity at some point in the near future?</p> \n<p>To determine if augmented reality was actually a beneficial marketing technology, I asked 300 consumers about their experiences with AR product previews using Lucid survey software.</p> \n<p>In the survey, consumers were asked, \"Have you ever purchased a product (such as furniture or clothing) after seeing an augmented-reality preview of what it would look like in real life?\"</p> \n<p>Since the technology is still rather new, you might expect consumers to say they've never used an AR product preview. However, you might also be wondering if those who've used an AR product preview actually converted.</p> \n<p>If you think that the general population hasn't used this new retail technology, you might be surprised by the result below.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Do%20AR%20Product%20Previews%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Research%5D.png?width=600&amp;name=Do%20AR%20Product%20Previews%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Research%5D.png\" alt=\"have you purchased something after using an AR preview\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 10px; text-align: center;\"><em>Data Source: </em><a href=\"https://luc.id/\">Lucid</a></p> \n<p>According to the survey, 52% of consumers have purchased at least one item after seeing an AR preview of how it would look in real life. Over 30% of that group have purchased multiple products after previewing them with AR.</p> \n<p>So, what does this mean for small or medium-sized retailers?</p> \n<p>Understandably, you might not be able to afford AR technology to highlight your products just yet. However, the fact that more brands are using this feature to influence purchasing decisions means that technology and personalized digital marketing tactics like AR previews will likely become more prominent.</p> \n<p>Just because you can't afford AR now, doesn't mean you'll be unable to leverage it in the future. As augmented reality grows more prominent and more valuable to businesses, AR ecommerce tools might become more accessible or competitively priced. This is a theme we've seen with the influence of artificial intelligence.</p> \n<p>While the technology was pricey and inaccessible to small-to-medium businesses at first, there are now a number of affordable out-of-the-box tools that marketers and businesses can leverage.</p> \n<p>Even if you can't take advantage of the latest marketing technology today, it's still important to keep up with how other retailers are using it -- especially if they're selling products in a similar category as you.</p> \n<p>Below, I'll walk you through a few AR strategies that effectively benefit retailers now, or could be a vital product marketing tactic in the future:</p> \n<h2>3 AR Product Marketing Strategies to Watch in 2020</h2> \n<h3>Mobile Previews on Ecommerce Sites</h3> \n<p>With this strategy, a mobile ecommerce website visitor can find a product they're interested in, open a camera when tapping an AR preview button, and then view how the product -- such as furniture -- will look in the room they're in. Some ecommerce platforms also allow prospects to see what an accessory such as glasses, will look on their face. If a customer likes what they see in an AR preview, they can exit the preview and make a purchase without setting foot in a store.</p> \n<p>With increasing mobile ecommerce, this strategy allows visitors to discover a product through mobile search or an app, visit an ecommerce site, get an idea of what it looks like in real life, and then smoothly purchase it wherever they are. It also eliminates key friction points that could halt a purchase such as going to the store or not finding a product in the right size or color in a physical retail location.</p> \n<p>At the moment, we're already seeing corporations like <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/augmented-reality-examples\">IKEA, Home Depot, and Amazon</a> embrace AR product previews on mobile sites and apps. But, this strategy might not be totally inaccessible to smaller businesses.</p> \n<p>For example, a <a href=\"https://www.shopify.com/blog/shopify-ar\">small bicycle retailer called PureCycles</a> wanted to improve its website's mobile experience and conversions. With a large catalog of bicycle product shots taken from multiple angles, they created AR previews with Shopify.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 480px; max-height: 270px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/H_jkw04GgXY?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>PureCycles says its use of virtual previews <a href=\"https://www.shopify.com/blog/shopify-ar\">improved the customer experience on mobile-optimized browsers</a> and allowed customers to answer key questions about their products, such as \"Will this bicycle fit in my small apartment?\"</p> \n<h3>Virtual Mirrors</h3> \n<p>Ever seen a shirt you loved in a clothing store but couldn't find it in your size? Or, have you ever wanted to test out expensive makeup before buying it? These are two business cases that could call for AR mirrors, often called \"virtual\" or \"magic\" mirrors.</p> \n<p>With AR mirror technology, you can stand in front of a screen in selfie mode, and see an overlay of how products in the store's catalog will look on you in the right size or shade.</p> \n<p>After your virtual experience, some virtual mirrors will allow you to order the product or send yourself a link for it so you can order it later. This prevents any additional friction related to having to wait until the item comes back in stock.</p> \n<p>This virtual process also allows you to see products that the store sells but might not sell in the store due to seasonality or space-related limitations.</p> \n<p>This strategy is used by Charlotte Tilbury, a UK-based beauty retailer.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 640px; max-height: 360px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe src=\"https://player.vimeo.com/video/188396641?app_id=122963\" width=\"640\" height=\"360\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>Virtual mirrors, purchased and installed by <a href=\"https://holition.com/\">Holition</a>, line the boutique's walls. When a customer looks into one, the camera and software scan the measurements and skin tone of their face. From there, the customer taps different makeup items on the screen to see how the products will look on their face. Here's a quick video demonstration of how the software works:</p> \n<h3>Social Media Filters</h3> \n<p>Have you ever launched Instagram or Facebook Stories and noticed new AR filters that allowed you to test out products directly through your app? If not, you'll definitely see more of this soon.</p> \n<p>Recognizing the low-hanging fruit of AR previews in ecommerce, <a href=\"https://www.voguebusiness.com/technology/facebook-fidji-simo-diane-von-furstenberg-fashion-advertising\">Facebook and Instagram</a>, are actively taking steps to provide more commerce that leverage this technology. For example, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-experiments-with-augmented-reality-advertising-2019-12\">in late 2019</a>, Facebook made AR filter ads available in Facebook Ads. These ads allow users to test out products in Facebook Stories and its News Feed.</p> \n<p>Here's an example of what one of these ads might look like:</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Do%20AR%20Product%20Previews%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Research%5D-2.png?width=557&amp;name=Do%20AR%20Product%20Previews%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Research%5D-2.png\" alt=\"AR social media product filters\" width=\"557\" style=\"width: 557px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 10px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-experiments-with-augmented-reality-advertising-2019-12\" style=\"font-style: italic; font-weight: normal;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Leveraging product-centric AR filters on social media provides the perks of the mobile AR previews without relying on shoppers to actually visit an ecommerce site.</p> \n<p>As social media users tap through their friend's Stories or content, they might notice a Story with an AR product in it or discover and AR preview that they can experience. These types of experiences are much more natural than seeing an influencer posting about a dress or makeup item, visiting the ecommerce site, and then doing added research to see if it's the right shade.</p> \n<p>While social AR previews are still in early phases, platforms <a href=\"https://www.voguebusiness.com/technology/facebook-fidji-simo-diane-von-furstenberg-fashion-advertising\">like Facebook</a> are already identifying types of retailers that could thrive with these tools. For example, AR features that allow users to preview products via social media could be a game-changer in the world of fashion and beauty. In 2018, this industry already saw a <a href=\"https://www.brandtotal.com/\">164% social media revenue increase</a> from paid promotions.</p> \n<p>With social media users actively engaging with paid beauty ads, brands that are able to leverage AR on Facebook and Instagram would be able to reach social-media-friendly audiences on popular platforms and allow them to try new products.</p> \n<p>One company that's already leveraging AR to highlight products on social media is Dior, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/a/r/?effect_id=510300079757378&amp;ch=ZGE4ZTRiZmRiZTFkZWIzZDRlNjA4YmE1M2EzMDAzMDc=\">which allows users to try looks</a> from its Fall/Winter fashion line on their Instagram Stories camera.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Do%20AR%20Product%20Previews%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Research%5D-1.png?width=600&amp;name=Do%20AR%20Product%20Previews%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Research%5D-1.png\" alt=\"product try on AR filters\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 10px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.thezoereport.com/p/diors-new-instagram-filter-lets-you-virtually-try-on-accessories-from-the-fallwinter-2019-runway-19267316\" style=\"font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>As social media and mobile surfing continue to dominate how <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/millennials-vs-gen-z\">millennials and Gen Z spend their time</a>, the need to invest in clever mobile advertising, such as AR ads, will also grow. .Although the combination of AR tactics and social media is still new -- and not worth blowing your budget on just yet -- you should still continue to follow brands and competitors that leverage it in case this technology becomes more accessible in the future.</p> \n<h2>What AR Success Means for Retailers</h2> \n<p>While the growth of AR shows how businesses are using new technology to benefit the customer journey, the effectiveness of AR and other retail technologies shows that customers are increasingly looking for digital, personalized, and frictionless shopping experiences.</p> \n<p>And this makes sense. More and more, people are using <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/millennials-vs-gen-z\">mobile ecommerce stores and online social platforms</a> to find, vet, and ultimately purchase products.</p> \n<p>Even if you do have a physical store, you'll need to embrace highly digital tactics to ensure that you're gaining brand awareness from people online along with people in your neighborhood.</p> \n<p>And while you shouldn't spend all of your money investing in AR, there are other tactics you can take on to inform your audience about your products or services. These include highlighting <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-product-research\">your products on social media</a>, launching a small but scalable <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ecommerce-marketing\">ecommerce store</a>, or sending customers <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-personalization-examples\">personalized emails</a> about products they might like based on what they've already purchased from your store.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Far-product-preview-data&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" Bump)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Do%20AR%20Product%20Previews%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Research%5D.png?width=600&name=Do%20AR%20Product%20Previews%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Research%5D.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn32@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-22-25-423_a7d862e465470285.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Do%20AR%20Product%20Previews%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Research%5D-2.png?width=557&name=Do%20AR%20Product%20Previews%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Research%5D-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn47@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-22-21-097_20e061aae4d840ed.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Do%20AR%20Product%20Previews%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Research%5D-1.png?width=600&name=Do%20AR%20Product%20Previews%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Research%5D-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn12@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-22-27-937_04bd5a30c9845b5a.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Far-product-preview-data&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn48@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-22-23-650_260505a34aa04423.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598311336426},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","title":"Discover Your Writing Genius: 8 Tips for Doing Your Best Work in 2020","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/discover-writing-genius","description":"<p>As marketers, it can be difficult to continue to produce high-quality content when we don't feel creative or inspired.</p> \n<p>And it can be especially challenging when we're on a tight deadline.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Henneke Duistermaat, writer and founder of <span>Enchanting Marketing</span>, knows the feeling well — as she describes it in her <a href=\"https://www.enchantingmarketing.com/discover-your-writing-genius/\">latest infographic</a>, we often believe writing simply means creating \"great stuff\", when in reality, it entails research, multiple revisions, messy first drafts ... and even time for procrastination.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Fortunately, there are strategies you can implement to relieve the pressures of writing, get outside your comfort zone, and befriend your inner critic.</p> \n<p>If you're in a writing slump or looking for some inspiraiton, take a look at Henneke's hand-drawn infographic to learn 8 tips for creating your best work.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/How%20to%20Discover%20Your%20Writing%20Genius.jpg?width=720&amp;name=How%20to%20Discover%20Your%20Writing%20Genius.jpg\" alt=\"How to Discover Your Writing Genius\" width=\"720\" style=\"width: 720px;\"></p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fdiscover-writing-genius&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":7159,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"383c85538302514e8065b11121338be5","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Caroline Forsey","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/How%20to%20Discover%20Your%20Writing%20Genius.jpg?width=720&name=How%20to%20Discover%20Your%20Writing%20Genius.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn100@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-22-23-883_30bdf8586619d0bf.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fdiscover-writing-genius&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn9@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-22-21-065_099f490bffa2f8cf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598311336432},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","title":"The Ultimate Online Editing and Proofreading Checklist for Writers","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ultimate-editing-checklist","description":"<p>The writing process is a chance to let creativity fly and tell a story with your own words.</p>  \n<p>Another, less glamorous part of the writing process is editing.</p> \n<p>As you may know, proofreading is essential for any blog or ebook. It makes your work look professional, and without editing, it's unclear to know how many mistakes or readability problems being published.</p> \n<p>Remembering every single little grammar and editing rule is nonsense. While many become instincts over time, humans are known to make mistakes. That's why we've created a checklist for you to use while editing so you have a point of reference while proofreading.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>This list isn't just about grammar rules; it also includes tips from topic selection, SEO, to promotion. Essentially, it can take you from beginning to the end of what you write.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Copy%20of%20Featured%20Snippet%20Template%20-%20Bullets-1.png?width=1080&amp;name=Copy%20of%20Featured%20Snippet%20Template%20-%20Bullets-1.png\" alt=\"editing and proofreading checklist graphic\" width=\"1080\" style=\"width: 1080px;\">Read on for our complete editing and proofreading checklist — made with the content creator in mind.</p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">The Content Creator's Editing Checklist</h2> \n<p>In this checklist, we will go over nine sections, listed below.</p> \n<h3>Topics</h3> \n<p>We'll start at the beginning with topics. Knowing which topic to write about can come from various places, but these tips will double check that what you're writing about will resonate with your readers and have the chance to rock it with SEO.</p> \n<div>\n Does this topic align with our content strategy? Will our readers/\n <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/buyer-persona-definition-under-100-sr\">buyer personas </a>care about it?\n</div> \n<div>\n &nbsp;\n</div> \n<div>\n Have we covered this topic comprehensively in the past? Will it add anything new and interesting amongst all the content clutter on the web? If both answers are yes, consider \n <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/guide-to-updating-republishing-blogging-content-ht\">updating and republishing</a> the original draft.\n</div> \n<div>\n &nbsp;\n</div> \n<div>\n Can the angle be tweaked to be even \n <em>more</em> interesting?\n</div> \n<div> \n <p> Does this topic have SEO have high potential?</p> \n <p> Is this topic relevant to the industry/timely?</p> \n <h3>Structure &amp; Format</h3> \n <p>How do you structure your pieces? This section makes sure your content is formatted in the best way for readability. It also provides some room for checking consistency.</p> \n <div>\n  Is this the right format for the content? Does this topic work better as a longer form ebook? Or in a shorter form, like a listicle?\n </div> \n <div>\n  &nbsp;\n </div> \n <div>\n  Is the flow of the content logical? Are the chapters/headers/ideas organized in an order that makes sense and naturally guides readers through the content?\n </div> \n <div>\n  &nbsp;\n </div> \n <div>\n  Are paragraphs 2-3 sections long for readability?\n </div> \n <div> \n  <div>\n   &nbsp;\n  </div> \n  <div> \n   <span>Are your headers formatted consistently -- not just within this piece of content? Are different header styles (H2 vs. H3 vs. H4) being used to properly denote content hierarchy?</span>\n  </div> \n  <div>\n   &nbsp;\n  </div> \n  <div> \n   <div>\n    Is the content comprehensive?\n    <span>Are all major points associated with the topic covered in the post?</span>\n   </div> \n   <div>\n    &nbsp;\n   </div> \n   <div> \n    <div> Can you incorporate numbered lists and/or bullets to make it easier for readers to skim, scan, and identify important takeaways?\n    </div> \n    <div> \n     <div>\n      &nbsp;\n     </div> \n     <div> \n      <div> Are supporting images and visuals included where appropriate?\n      </div> \n      <div>\n       &nbsp;\n      </div> \n      <div> Are these visuals and images \n       <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/blog-post-image-selection-ht-list\">high quality</a> and interesting? Have they been resized and compressed so keep page load time short? \n       <h3><span style=\"font-size: 1em;\">Copy</span></h3> \n       <p><span style=\"font-size: 1em;\">We can't have an editing checklist without a section to double-check your copy. These are little things to make sure the narrative of your writing is succinct and engaging, as well as minor grammar edits.</span></p> \n       <div>\n        Is the content well-written? Is the writing interesting, entertaining, and easy to read?\n       </div> \n       <div> \n        <div>\n         &nbsp;\n        </div> \n        <div> \n         <div>\n          Does the content tell a story?\n         </div> \n         <div>\n          &nbsp;\n         </div> \n         <div> \n          <div>\n           Do the transitions make sense and flow well?\n          </div> \n          <div>\n           &nbsp;\n          </div> \n          <div>\n           Is the grammar correct? \n           <div>\n            <br>\n            <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-write-introduction-quick-tip-ht\">Does the introduction capture the reader's attention</a>? Is it interesting enough to get the reader to keep reading?\n           </div> \n           <div>\n            &nbsp;\n           </div> \n           <div>\n            Does the intro tee up the rest of the content well and explain the value the reader will get out of reading it? \n            <div>\n             &nbsp;\n            </div> \n            <div> \n             <div>\n              <span>Are the headers keyword-optimized, </span>\n              <span>compelling, and clear?</span>\n             </div> \n            </div> \n            <div>\n             <br>Does the tone of the writing align with the content being presented?\n            </div> \n            <div>\n             &nbsp;\n            </div> \n            <div>\n             <span>Does the content's voice coincide with the overall voice of our content and company?</span>\n            </div> \n            <div> \n             <div>\n              &nbsp;\n             </div> \n             <div>\n              Yet, are we still allowing the writer's individual writing personality to shine through? \n              <div> \n               <h3>Attribution</h3> \n               <p>Any good editor makes sure he/she is giving credit where credit is due. Here's what to think about.</p> \n               <div>\n                Are statistics, data, quotes, ideas, etc. \n                <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33098/How-Not-to-Steal-People-s-Content-on-the-Web.aspx\">properly attributed</a> to the original source with a link back?\n               </div> \n               <div>\n                &nbsp;\n               </div> \n               <div> \n                <div>\n                 Is the data interpreted correctly (i.e. not lost in translation) from the original source?\n                </div> \n                <div>\n                 &nbsp;\n                </div> \n                <div> \n                 <div>\n                  In any quotations, do we have the right spelling of the name and job title/company of the person quoted?\n                 </div> \n                 <div> \n                  <div>\n                   &nbsp;\n                  </div> \n                  <div>\n                   Are we actually \n                   <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33098/How-Not-to-Steal-People-s-Content-on-the-Web.aspx\">allowed to use these photos/images</a>?\n                   <em> (<a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/internet-copyright-law-failure\">Here's a cautionary tale about internet copyright law</a>.)</em> \n                   <h3>Title</h3> \n                   <p>Titles are the first exposure most of your readers get to your piece. How are you going to use that to your advantage? Go over some tips for the effectiveness of your title.</p> \n                   <div>\n                    Is the title compelling and interesting enough to get people to click through and read on?\n                   </div> \n                   <div>\n                    &nbsp;\n                   </div> \n                   <div> \n                    <div>\n                     Does the title accurately reflect the content within? Avoid being overly sensational or bombastic.\n                    </div> \n                    <div>\n                     &nbsp;\n                    </div> \n                    <div>\n                     Is the title brief and concise? \n                     <em>(Tip: Keep in mind longer titles will get cut off in search engine results.)</em>\n                    </div> \n                    <div> \n                     <div>\n                      <br>Is the title keyword-conscious without being keyword-heavy and sacrificing user experience and clickthroughs (\n                      <span>see also the section about search engine optimization)</span>?\n                     </div> \n                    </div> \n                    <div> \n                     <h3>Style Guide Alignment</h3> \n                     <p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33575/Introducing-the-Internet-Marketing-Written-Style-Guide.aspx\">Written style guides </a>serve as the commonly acknowledged authority when questions of grammar, punctuation, and style come up in writing. A style guide answers questions like whether you use title case for article titles and headers; whether you capitalize the word <em>internet</em>; or whether you use the Oxford comma.</p> \n                     <p>You can either adopt an already-established style guide, like the AP Stylebook, or create an in-house version that enables you to borrow from different schools of thought and address any nuances specific to your industry or company. The important thing is to be consistent across all content you publish. Here's the main question you should ask yourself ...</p> \n                     <div>\n                      Does anything contradict our style guide? \n                      <em>(Tip: If you don't have a style guide, you can <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/the-internet-marketing-written-style-guide\">download HubSpot's and customize it as you see fit</a>.)</em> \n                      <h3>SEO</h3> \n                      <p>One of the most important parts of a post, SEO helps others and search engines find your piece. Are you doing all you can to boost that? Check your work below.</p> \n                      <div>\n                       Have you done your \n                       <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-do-keyword-research-ht\">keyword research</a> to identify relevant keywords with which to optimize your content?\n                      </div> \n                      <div> \n                       <div>\n                        &nbsp;\n                       </div> \n                       <div>\n                        Did you optimize your content using \n                        <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/blog-seo-modern-marketer-optimize-your-posts-ht\">on-page SEO best practices?</a>\n                       </div> \n                      </div> \n                      <div>\n                       &nbsp;\n                      </div> \n                      <div>\n                       <span>If it's a blog post or web/landing page, is there a catchy, concise, and clear meta description to encourage clickthroughs in search engine results pages (SERPs)?</span>\n                      </div> \n                      <div>\n                       &nbsp;\n                      </div> \n                      <div> \n                       <div>\n                        <span>Are there <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/34005/How-to-Pick-the-Perfect-CTA-for-Every-Blog-Post.aspx\">relevant calls-to-action</a> (CTAs) included where appropriate to encourage conversion into subscribers, leads, etc.?<em>(Tip: Try the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/keyword-based-blog-conversion-optimization\">keyword-based conversion optimization method</a>!)</em></span>\n                       </div> \n                      </div> \n                      <h3>Finishing Touches</h3> \n                      <p>You're almost there. To make sure your post is excellent rather than mediocre, use this section to do a final run-through.</p> \n                      <div>\n                       Are there internal links to other resources, landing pages, or blog articles that might be helpful to the reader (or improve your SEO)?\n                      </div> \n                      <div>\n                       &nbsp;\n                      </div> \n                      <div>\n                       Were those links tested to confirm they work and send readers to the right place?\n                      </div> \n                      <div>\n                       &nbsp;\n                      </div> \n                      <div> \n                       <div>\n                        Is the content spell-checked?\n                       </div> \n                       <div>\n                        &nbsp;\n                       </div> \n                       <div> \n                        <div>\n                         Are any company names referenced spelled and styled correctly?\n                        </div> \n                        <div>\n                         &nbsp;\n                        </div> \n                        <div> \n                         <div>\n                          Does the content contain any sensitive or controversial information that we need to get anyone's approval on before publishing (e.g. legal or PR department)?\n                         </div> \n                         <div>\n                          &nbsp;\n                         </div> \n                         <div> \n                          <div>\n                           Have any stats cited or quotes used been fact checked?\n                          </div> \n                          <div> \n                           <div>\n                            &nbsp;\n                           </div> \n                           <div> \n                            <div>\n                             If it's a blog post, is it tagged with the appropriate topic tags?\n                            </div> \n                            <div>\n                             &nbsp;\n                            </div> \n                            <div> \n                             <div>\n                              Was the publish date/time double-checked so we're not accidentally scheduling for 8 p.m. instead of 8 a.m.?\n                              <em> (It happens. We've done it.)</em>\n                             </div> \n                             <div>\n                              &nbsp;\n                             </div> \n                             <div> \n                              <div>\n                               Are there opportunities to make the content more social (e.g. creating \n                               <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-create-embed-codes-generator-infographic-content-ht\">embed codes</a> and adding \n                               <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/29544/The-Ultimate-Cheat-Sheet-for-Creating-Social-Media-Buttons.aspx\">Pinterest 'Pin it' buttons</a> to proprietary images/infographics/visuals/charts, adding \n                               <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/29544/The-Ultimate-Cheat-Sheet-for-Creating-Social-Media-Buttons.aspx\">tweet links</a>, \n                               <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/29544/The-Ultimate-Cheat-Sheet-for-Creating-Social-Media-Buttons.aspx\">social sharing buttons</a>, etc.)?\n                              </div> \n                              <div>\n                               &nbsp;\n                              </div> \n                              <div> \n                               <div>\n                                Did we include examples (real or hypothetical) to illustrate our points?\n                               </div> \n                               <div>\n                                &nbsp;\n                               </div> \n                               <div> \n                                <div>\n                                 Did we use data, statistics, and quotations to back up our points?\n                                </div> \n                                <div>\n                                 &nbsp;\n                                </div> \n                                <div>\n                                 Are there other supporting elements that could enhance the content?\n                                </div> \n                               </div> \n                              </div> \n                              <div> \n                               <h3>Content Promotion</h3> \n                               <p>Now that your piece is complete, you've gotta promote it. This section gives you different ideas of how to get your writing out there.</p> \n                               <div>\n                                 Have you promoted it on relevant social media channels? \n                                <div>\n                                 &nbsp;\n                                </div> \n                                <div> \n                                 <div>\n                                  <span>Have you emailed it to subscribers, leads, and other relevant contacts?</span>\n                                 </div> \n                                 <div>\n                                  &nbsp;\n                                 </div> \n                                 <div> \n                                  <div>\n                                    Can you put some paid promotion behind it using paid platforms or via advertising options available by social media sites like Facebook and Twitter?\n                                  </div> \n                                  <div>\n                                   &nbsp;\n                                  </div> \n                                  <div> \n                                   <div>\n                                    <span>Can you syndicate it to other publishing platforms like </span>\n                                    <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/linkedin-publishing-all-members-nj\">LinkedIn Pulse</a>\n                                    <span> or Medium to expose it to other audiences?</span>\n                                   </div> \n                                   <div>\n                                    &nbsp;\n                                   </div> \n                                   <div>\n                                    <span>Writing is hard and editing isn't that easy, either. Keeping this checklist saved or bookmarked is a resource to turn back to when you get stuck or need an extra check over your work.</span>\n                                   </div> \n                                   <div>\n                                    <span></span>\n                                   </div> \n                                   <div>\n                                    <span></span>\n                                   </div> \n                                  </div> \n                                 </div> \n                                </div> \n                               </div> \n                              </div> \n                             </div> \n                            </div> \n                           </div> \n                          </div> \n                         </div> \n                        </div> \n                       </div> \n                      </div> \n                     </div> \n                    </div> \n                   </div> \n                  </div> \n                 </div> \n                </div> \n               </div> \n              </div> \n             </div> \n            </div> \n           </div> \n          </div> \n         </div> \n        </div> \n       </div> \n      </div> \n     </div> \n    </div> \n   </div> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</div>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fultimate-editing-checklist&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 12 Aug 2020 12:06:00 +0000","feedId":7159,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"aa0ce8e51d985333702b2ce12af71014","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Kayla Carmicheal","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Copy%20of%20Featured%20Snippet%20Template%20-%20Bullets-1.png?width=1080&name=Copy%20of%20Featured%20Snippet%20Template%20-%20Bullets-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn46@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-22-25-465_353de7eecf4e477b.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fultimate-editing-checklist&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn85@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-22-21-419_87bbbe28d8635369.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598311336438},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:22:16","title":"The Move to Ecommerce: How Retailers Can Adapt During a Crisis","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/retailers-adapt-crisis","description":"<p>Ecommerce is an undeniably powerful opportunity for retail stores to increase sales and reach new customers. And, in 2020 and beyond, it will continue to become an increasingly popular shopping choice for many consumers.&nbsp;</p>  \n<p>In fact, Statista predicts that ecommerce revenue will <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ecommerce\">surpass $638 billion in the U.S.</a> by 2022.</p> \n<p>And, in 2020, amidst the global crisis, ecommerce is fast becoming the go-to model for keeping retail businesses afloat.</p> \n<p>Brands that have adopted ecommerce are seeing success, particularly since most shoppers are staying at home.</p> \n<p>But, for companies considering how to shift into ecommerce, such a drastic shift can feel like a challenge.</p> \n<p>To ease the burden on retailers, we share eight steps you should follow when implementing an ecommerce <a href=\"https://venngage.com/blog/project-management-plan/\">project management plan</a>.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h3>1. Pick-up and Delivery Services</h3> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0px; max-width: 540px; min-width: 256px; display: block; border-radius: 50%; flex-grow: 0; height: 20px; width: 20px;\">\n        &nbsp;\n       </div> \n       <div style=\" width: 0; height: 0; border-top: 2px solid transparent; border-left: 6px solid #f4f4f4; border-bottom: 2px solid transparent; transform: translateX(16px) translateY(-4px) rotate(30deg)\">\n        &nbsp;\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <div style=\"margin-left: auto;\"> \n       <div style=\" width: 0px; border-top: 8px solid #F4F4F4; border-right: 8px solid transparent; transform: translateY(16px);\">\n        &nbsp;\n       </div> \n       <div style=\" background-color: #F4F4F4; flex-grow: 0; height: 12px; width: 16px; transform: translateY(-4px);\">\n        &nbsp;\n       </div> \n       <div style=\" width: 0; height: 0; border-top: 8px solid #F4F4F4; border-left: 8px solid transparent; transform: translateY(-4px) translateX(8px);\">\n        &nbsp;\n       </div>\n      </div>\n     </div></a> \n    <p style=\" margin:8px 0 0 0; padding:0 4px;\"> <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B90G8gihVaT/?utm_source=ig_embed&amp;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\" color:#000; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px; text-decoration:none; word-wrap:break-word;\">COVID-19 Update: Sotto Sotto dining room closed. New Contact-free delivery and takeout. To our dear Sotto Sotto patrons, We take your health and safety very seriously, for this reason, we will be closing Sotto Sotto dining room service starting today. We feel we must do our part to ‘flatten the curve’, and help ensure our collective safety. We look forward to serving you again soon at our Toronto and Oakville locations. New this week - Contact-free delivery: For the first time Sotto Sotto is offering delivery with Contact-free option; much of our full menu will be available, plus larger portion Chef-specials which will be announced regularly on our social channels.  Our strict kitchen safety protocols have been heightened to include all up-to-date recommended precautions from Toronto Public Health. This is done for your safety and peace of mind. Controlled environment pick-up will also be available so that we can continue to offer you the magic and romance of Sotto Sotto. For more information please call us at: SOTTO SOTTO TORONTO: (416)962-0011 SOTTO SOTTO OAKVILLE: (905)844-5545 With love now and always. Stay safe and healthy. Andrà tutto bene, Marisa Rocca, Ristorante Sotto Sotto (owner/founder) @marisarocca27 @sottosotto @sottosottooakville</a></p> \n    <p style=\" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;\">A post shared by <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/sottosotto/?utm_source=ig_embed&amp;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px;\"> Sotto Sotto Toronto</a> (@sottosotto) on Mar 16, 2020 at 5:12pm PDT</p>\n   </div>\n  </blockquote> \n </div>\n</div> \n<p>Due to the current global conditions, consumers have been staying indoors — and, as a result, they have become accustomed to doing most activities from their homes, including shopping.</p> \n<p>Retail has been directly impacted by this change in consumer behavior. To stay healthy, people aren't walking into stores and restaurants to make purchases anymore. Instead, they're typically making those transactions online.</p> \n<p>Additionally, the convenience of having items delivered to one's home has changed the shopping experience for consumers. People will likely continue to prefer ecommerce even after the global crisis is over.</p> \n<p>The same goes for pick-ups — although it requires the customer to leave their home and take precautions, the process has become streamlined and requires little interaction. Ultimately, retailers will need to note these conveniences and how effectively they have drawn customers. This is a model that will need to be implemented post-crisis.</p> \n<p>To shift to an ecommerce model, companies need to first research <a href=\"https://www.shipbob.com/blog/ecommerce-shipping/\">competitive shipping prices</a> to get the best deals. Customers want more items shipped, and prohibitive shipping costs might be a deal-breaker for some of your customers.</p> \n<p>The existence of a shipping option also means investing in packaging, which means custom branded boxes and packages will become a mainstay for stores. Brands will also need to be aware of the price and quality of their packaging — they will be expected to invest in <a href=\"https://packhelp.com/sustainable-packaging/\">sustainable packaging</a> to make for a safer future.</p> \n<p>Ultimately, shipping and delivery is a major component of ecommerce and can incentivize customers to become long-term advocates of your brand if implemented successfully.</p> \n<h3>2. More Health and Safety Measures</h3> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis-1.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.worksafebc.com/en/about-us/covid-19-updates/covid-19-returning-safe-operation/retail\" style=\"font-style: italic; font-weight: bold;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>The world has been looking forward to life after COVID-19, but the reality is that we will be adjusting to life <em>with </em>it.</p> \n<p>The hygiene practices initiated during the lockdown procedures will need to be maintained, especially as more retailers open up.</p> \n<p>Companies need to scout out strategic locations around their stores to add sanitizers. More cleaning crews will need to be brought in regularly to disinfect the premises.</p> \n<p>Social distancing measures may have been relaxed in certain parts of the world, but there will be occasional flare-ups. Retailers should prepare to reduce the number of people allowed within their building sites — which could mean a fluctuation in sales and revenue.</p> \n<p>As we have mentioned, curbside pickups and home deliveries will become the norm, but brands need to ensure that these items are handled with care.</p> \n<p>Current staff members are likely already trained on safety measures, but any new members will need to be on-boarded accordingly. Additionally, businesses will need to work to keep their employees safe within the premises.</p> \n<p>The world has changed and we will be feeling the effects for a while after — preparing for a safer working environment can only benefit a business in the long-run.</p> \n<h3>3. Remote Work</h3> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://news.gallup.com/poll/306695/workers-discovering-affinity-remote-work.aspx\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Retailers may not be directly impacted by remote work, but their customers will be — and this needs to be factored in when designing the project plan for shifting into ecommerce.</p> \n<p>While stores need their in-store staff to function, a large majority of their customers will <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/remote-work-tips\">continue to work from home</a> for the rest of 2020 and beyond.</p> \n<p>Many companies are also considering making a portion of their staff permanently remote, which will impact how they access retail services like food, clothes, and entertainment.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>4. Diminished Brand Awareness</h3> \n<p>The quarantine period put paid to all theories about brand awareness and loyalty.</p> \n<p>Consumers were so desperate for products that they bought them from whichever brand was available — despite being patrons of other companies for years before.</p> \n<p>And this trend may well continue — the 'get whatever you can' mindset has set in quickly and will be difficult to shake, and the impact on brand awareness will be felt for long after.</p> \n<p>Since the world has had months of needing specific items and grabbing at whatever was available, consumers will find that supporting a single brand isn't always a valuable position for them.</p> \n<p>With so many consumers dipping into multiple brands, retailers will have to work twice as hard to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/brand-awareness\">spread awareness about their business</a>.</p> \n<p>Companies would do well to adapt their brand awareness activities to highlight their ecommerce efforts — such as more online shopping options, delivery, and pickup services.</p> \n<p>Creating messaging that boosts the business' ecommerce aspects and opportunities will go a long way in attracting audiences, as it is relevant and timely.</p> \n<p>Regular updates about health and safety measures will also reassure customers enough to give them an incentive to visit stores.</p> \n<p>Retailers need to accept that competition will be more fraught than before — keep an eye on the gaps that appear in the market and use those as, and when, they appear.</p> \n<p>Consumers have an abundance of choices — narrow down their focus by highlighting the added value you can give them in your ecommerce communication plans.</p> \n<h3>5. Virtual Experiences</h3> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/9pNibZOzslU\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>With remote work becoming more of a norm across the world, retailers will have to find new ways to create memorable experiences and relationships with customers.</p> \n<p>Since consumers won't be visiting stores as often as they used to pre-pandemic, businesses need to look to online sources to create those experiences.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.wishpond.com/post/115675437303/how-to-get-more-likes-on-instagram\">Social media has become a lifeline</a> for most consumers and this is something that businesses can use to promote their products and services.</p> \n<p>Several companies successfully kept their audiences engaged by hosting live streams on YouTube or Instagram Stories of classes, product demos, and expert interviews.</p> \n<p>The need to remain socially distanced and safe has led to retailers creating online versions of their in-house experiences, such as <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/augmented-reality-retail\">virtual dressing rooms and fittings</a>.</p> \n<p>Businesses can also create AR filters on Instagram and Snapchat for consumers to try on products like makeup and clothes, as well as for gamification.</p> \n<p>The more online a business can be in the future, the better they will be able to engage with their customers.</p> \n<h3>6. Offer Discounts and Gift Cards</h3> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis-3.png?width=456&amp;name=The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis-3.png\" alt=\"\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 456px;\" width=\"456\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://saveourfaves.org/\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>The pandemic has hit a large contingent of consumers very hard — and this hardship is set to continue.</p> \n<p>Spending ability and disposable income will decrease as a result, which means businesses will have to work twice as hard to incentivize customers to purchase from them.</p> \n<p>Brands should look at a more cohesive <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/customer-centric\">customer-centric approach</a> to their marketing — giving customers a reason to consistently engage with the brand.</p> \n<p>To mitigate reduced consumer spending, retail brands should offer more discounts, package deals, and special offers.</p> \n<p>Employ incentives to encourage customers to use your ecommerce services — it will act as an advertisement for your virtual platforms, which users are more interested in now.</p> \n<p>Discounts can also help in amplifying sales of underperforming product categories — they look more lucrative with a smaller price tag and will sell better, reducing inventory.</p> \n<p>Gift cards are a great way to assure future business while bringing in immediate revenue.</p> \n<h3>7. Review Supplier Orders</h3> \n<p>There is still so much uncertainty around which items will move quickly that having excess inventory as a restaurant or a retailer could lead to revenue losses in 2020.</p> \n<p>Retailers should be identifying overstocked items in their warehouses. You'll want to determine which items aren't selling well, and order fewer of those.</p> \n<p>Of course, it's important not to be out of stock of popular items, as that will impact sales — there is a delicate balance that has to be reached here.</p> \n<p>An <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/inventory-management\">inventory management system</a> will help to track items in stock and determine which ones are selling out faster than others.</p> \n<p>To ensure inventories aren't full, retailers should work with their suppliers to slow down the production of certain items — if ecommerce sales pick up, production can be increased.</p> \n<p>Also, you'll want to look into setting up longer payment delivery methods for suppliers — this will help companies retain capital and keep the business afloat until more sales are made.</p> \n<h3>8. Loyalty Marketing</h3> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis-2.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www2.hm.com/en_us/member/info.html\"><em><span style=\"font-size: 11px;\">Image Source</span></em></a></p> \n<p>Repeat customers make up the bulk of revenue and profits for most businesses — building a loyal community of customers is thus a priority, especially during such uncertain times.</p> \n<p>Focusing the business' efforts on loyalty marketing will make a difference to the bottom line and should be included in your ecommerce project plan.</p> \n<p>For the rest of 2020, brands will need to work on getting more loyal customers — incentives like discounts have been known to work in this area.</p> \n<p>But to create genuine brand loyalty, a few discounts here and there won't make a huge impact.</p> \n<p>This is where <a href=\"https://appinstitute.com/customer-loyalty-programs/\">customer loyalty programs</a> can be a huge draw. A points system that rewards customers for buying improves engagement and repeat sales.</p> \n<p>Another way to improve consumer loyalty is through subscription services.</p> \n<p>Ecommerce subscriptions have been the basis of many successful business models, in a variety of fields, and they can help businesses boost customer loyalty.</p> \n<p>Subscriptions and loyalty programs give brands a database of people to regularly contact to improve sales — for companies that haven't instituted these, 2020 will be the best time to do so.</p> \n<p>The pandemic is changing the way businesses function, but ecommerce is quickly proving to be a safe model of work that companies can adopt.</p> \n<p>Since ecommerce isn't an arena that all companies are familiar with, to prepare for the shift, here are the steps businesses should include in their project scope:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Investing in pickup and delivery services</li> \n <li>Instituting more health and safety measures</li> \n <li>Acknowledging customers' remote working needs</li> \n <li>Adjusting for diminished brand awareness</li> \n <li>Creating more virtual experiences</li> \n <li>Offering discounts and gift cards</li> \n <li>Reviewing supplier orders and inventory management</li> \n <li>Focusing on loyalty marketing and subscription services</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Following these eight steps will help businesses move safely into an ecommerce environment to improve their sales in the future. Additionally, consider investing in <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ecommerce-software\">high-quality ecommerce software</a> to get your company up-to-speed quickly.&nbsp;</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fretailers-adapt-crisis&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\"
